text: i evacuated at 5 AM yesterday not knowing if my house would be standing when i get back. i don't know if it really is still there

Sad news.
God bless America

If the fires get much worse I hope the insurance companies can cover all the losses.  I heard some people say there were houses that cost upwards of $10 million but there were also cases of houses that had their insurance policies canceled due to fire risk.  It's just that if 1,000 homes are completely destroyed, insurance claims could be in the hundreds of millions.  I don't think most insurance companies could quickly come up with that amount of money and even if they do, it will probably be the last time they would offer policies to any homeowners in those fire-prone areas.  I never thought those fires could reach down into the residential areas in Los Angeles but with the strong winds blowing embers for miles it seems it can happen.  The more area the fire covers, the fire fighters become thinned out.  How many hours can a fire fighter go without rest or sleep while fires keep popping up.  That's a scary scenario that no one is prepared for.
I had wondered why no airdrops were being done but I didn't know they couldn't fly in heavy wind.  They need to drop fire-retardant to stop houses from easily igniting from sparks.  Four major fires all in different areas will be hard to control with limited resources.
Land developers really packed buildings in tight and in tough places to defend.
EVACUATE NOW! DON'T BE LIKE THOSE WHO REMAIN TRAP. PRAYING  FOR SAFETY. üôèüôèüôèüôèüôèüôè
Just learned that a co-worker lost his home in Altadena and another friend has evacuated his family from their 1st home. It's just heartbreaking

My mother's in assisted living in Arcadia and I know they evacuated half of Arcadia. Her facility's been without electricity for a day now and she's on the 2nd floor and can't use the elevator. The phones aren't working at the facility and my mom's phone lost battery so I can't get in contact and I'm watching all of this from New Jersey. I just hope they contain this fire before it comes down the mountain to the surrounding buildings even more.

Growing up in Southern California in the San Gabriel Valley, I recall seeing fires in the mountains every summer but they were always contained and never came down the mountains. Now it's seems like they are so powerful and devastating and he's right, it's really dry there now, more so then I remember as a child in the 70's and 80s.

Those poor souls... Yah please help ease their pain! My home town up in smoke; it (this devastation) hits different when it's your childhood town. I have been following the news all day. I just woke up 2 in the morning to catch up! We're all praying for help to stop the carnage!

Guarantee half the people driving on these streets have no business being there and are just slowing down those who do need to be there and also consuming resources (fuel) and setting themselves up to be one more person in trouble needing assistance. Yes, many are trying to evacuate and that's legit, but most are just lookylous getting in the way. I'd like to blame it on "California idiots" but this really does happen everywhere. I only worked emergency relief once long ago and am not a professional by any means, but I am intelligent enough to know that all I am likely to contribute in such a situation is to make things worse, so I stay home and watch on YouTube (unless I needed to evacuate and, hopefully, I had the means to do so before it was too late).
Thanks to newsome and Mayor and everyone to save us

In answer to questions of how these fires start,  look to PG&E.   I see you are having power outages.   Gee high winds and trees and brush not kept clear of powerlines that break or short out is more than likely.   That is what happened here in Butte county 6 years ago starting one of the worst and deadliest , the CAMP fire that burned the city of Paradise to the ground and killed over 80 or more people.  I was working a nursing home in Chico when we got notified that they were evacuating a nursing home, a retirement home the cities hospital.   They were inquiring how many of the half dozen care homes and the main hospital  had extra beds.  The nursing home up there was evacuating out the front door as the fire was b urning the back part.  About a quarter of our own staff lived in Paradise and surrounding areas. They were put up in the local hotels nearby.   The smoke was so bad that it completely blocked out the sun.
Looks like the Paradise fire that destroyed an entire city.  I believe evacuation warnings will increase for all of west los Angeles

Wishing everyone courage, safety, and consolation in this huge moment of loss and grief. I‚Äôve just came from the epicenter and it‚Äôs like a carpet bombed area. People crying on the streets, wounded trapped animals moaning in pain. House after house, block after block, for miles, still burning. People at the shelter wondering around their car with just a small suitcase and their pet. What you see on the news pales to the reality. There is no explanation for this senseless tragedy - but homes can be rebuilt, life cannot.

Unbelievable, the lack of preparedness , organization, manpower, lack of water, poor response times, lack of prevention measures, etc and you still sending billions to Ukr and Israel , get your priorities straight, what happened to America first. 
On the other hand, the earthquake in Tibet , 4500M above sea level , -18C temperatures, you see responders, rescuers, doctors, tents, food, warm clothing, communication lines resume , power resume etc. all responding record time , helicopters, planes, trucks , heavy moving machinery all rushing to the affected areas - all with clear objectives and organization. 
I would have expected US to be better prepared, organized, responsive to handle such a simple event. Why does this not happen in other countries , for example Austria ? 
The buck must stop somewhere. Lack of resources , lack of money, incompetence, negligence- how can a superpower look so bad. You can develop AI , super computing , super aircraft carriers , stealth jets but you can‚Äôt put out or even avoid a simple fire ? What a joke this looks to the world. Where is your America first ? What a shame.
